comments: Tests covering query state checkpointing smoke test cases

tests.name: recover_from_tail_query
tests.description: recover tail query from a state checkpoint

statements.query: create stream state_stream2 (id string, location string, value float, timestamp datetime64(3) default now64(3))
subscribe to select id, value from state_stream2 settings checkpoint_interval=1
insert into state_stream2(id, location, value, timestamp) values ('dev1', 'ca', 57.3, '2020-02-02 20:00:00')
insert into state_stream2(id, location, value, timestamp) values ('dev2', 'ca', 58.3, '2020-02-02 20:00:01')

tests.name: multiple_times_recover_from_tail_query_with_stateless_function
tests.description: multiple times recover tail query with stateless functions from a state checkpoint

statements.query: create stream state_stream2 (id string, location string, value float, timestamp datetime64(3) default now64(3))
subscribe to select id, value from state_stream2 settings checkpoint_interval=1
insert into state_stream2(id, location, value, timestamp) values ('dev1', 'ca', 57.3, '2020-02-02 20:00:00')
insert into state_stream2(id, location, value, timestamp) values ('dev2', 'ca', 58.3, '2020-02-02 20:00:01')
insert into state_stream2(id, location, value, timestamp) values ('dev6', 'ca', 66, '2020-02-02 20:00:04')

tests.name: recover_global_aggr_without_group_by
tests.description: recover global aggregation without group by from a state checkpoint

statements.query: create stream state_stream2 (id string, location string, value float, timestamp datetime64(3) default now64(3))
subscribe to select count(), sum(value), avg(value), min(value), max(value) from state_stream2 emit periodic 1s settings checkpoint_interval=1

tests.name: multiple_times_recover_global_aggr_without_group_by
tests.description: multiple times recover global aggregation without group by from a state checkpoint

statements.query: create stream state_stream2 (id string, location string, value float, timestamp datetime64(3) default now64(3))
subscribe to select count(), sum(value), avg(value), min(value), max(value) from state_stream2 emit periodic 1s settings checkpoint_interval=1

tests.name: recover_global_aggr_with_group_by
tests.description: recover global aggregation with group by from a state checkpoint

statements.query: create stream state_stream2 (id string, location string, value float, timestamp datetime64(3) default now64(3))
subscribe to select id, count(*), sum(value), avg(value), min(value), max(value) from state_stream2 group by id emit periodic 1s settings checkpoint_interval=1

tests.name: multiple_times_recover_global_aggr_with_group_by
tests.description: multiple times recover global aggregation with group by from a state checkpoint

statements.query: create stream state_stream2 (id string, location string, value float, timestamp datetime64(3) default now64(3))
subscribe to select id, count(*), sum(value), avg(value), min(value), max(value) from state_stream2 group by id emit periodic 1s settings checkpoint_interval=1

tests.name: recover_tumble_window_aggr
tests.description: recover tumble window aggregation from a state checkpoint

statements.query: create stream state_stream2 (id string, location string, value float, timestamp datetime64(3) default now64(3))
subscribe to select id, sum(value), window_start, window_end from tumble(state_stream2, timestamp, interval 5 second) group by id, window_start, window_end emit stream settings checkpoint_interval=1
insert into state_stream2(id, location, value, timestamp) values ('dev2', 'ca', 80, '2020-02-02 20:00:08')

tests.name: multiple_times_recover_tumble_window_aggr
tests.description: multiple times recover tumble window aggregation from a state checkpoint

statements.query: create stream state_stream2 (id string, location string, value float, timestamp datetime64(3) default now64(3))
subscribe to select id, sum(value), window_start, window_end from tumble(state_stream2, timestamp, interval 5 second) group by id, window_start, window_end emit stream settings checkpoint_interval=1
insert into state_stream2(id, location, value, timestamp) values ('dev2', 'ca', 80, '2020-02-02 20:00:05')

tests.name: recover_tumble_window_aggr_with_delay_interval
tests.description: recover tumble window aggregation with delay interval from a state checkpoint

statements.query: create stream state_stream2 (id string, location string, value float, timestamp datetime64(3) default now64(3))

subscribe to select emit_version() as emit_version, id, count(*), window_start, window_end from tumble(state_stream2, timestamp, interval 5 second) group by id, window_start, window_end emit stream after watermark and delay interval 2 second settings checkpoint_interval=1
insert into state_stream2(id, location, value, timestamp) values ('dev8', 'ca', 67, '2020-02-02 20:00:11')

tests.name: multiple_times_recover_tumble_window_aggr_with_delay_interval
tests.description: multiple times recover tumble window aggregation with delay interval from a state checkpoint

statements.query: create stream state_stream2 (id string, location string, value float, timestamp datetime64(3) default now64(3))

subscribe to select emit_version() as emit_version, id, count(*), window_start, window_end from tumble(state_stream2, timestamp, interval 5 second) group by id, window_start, window_end emit stream after watermark and delay interval 2 second settings checkpoint_interval=1
insert into state_stream2(id, location, value, timestamp) values ('dev8', 'ca', 67, '2020-02-02 20:00:11')

tests.name: recover_hopping_window_aggr
tests.description: recover hopping window aggregation from a state checkpoint

statements.query: create stream state_stream2 (id string, location string, value float, timestamp datetime64(3) default now64(3))

subscribe to select emit_version(), id, max(value), window_start, window_end from hop(state_stream2, timestamp, interval 3 second, interval 5 second) group by id, window_start, window_end emit stream settings checkpoint_interval=1
insert into state_stream2(id, location, value, timestamp) values ('dev6', 'ca', 69, '2020-02-02 20:00:06')
insert into state_stream2(id, location, value, timestamp) values ('dev8', 'ca', 68, '2020-02-02 20:00:07') ('dev8', 'ca', 67, '2020-02-02 20:00:10')

tests.name: multiple_times_recover_hopping_window_aggr
tests.description: multiple times recover hopping window aggregation from a state checkpoint

statements.query: create stream state_stream2 (id string, location string, value float, timestamp datetime64(3) default now64(3))

subscribe to select emit_version(), id, max(value), window_start, window_end from hop(state_stream2, timestamp, interval 3 second, interval 5 second) group by id, window_start, window_end emit stream settings checkpoint_interval=1
insert into state_stream2(id, location, value, timestamp) values ('dev6', 'ca', 69, '2020-02-02 20:00:06')
insert into state_stream2(id, location, value, timestamp) values ('dev8', 'ca', 68, '2020-02-02 20:00:07') ('dev8', 'ca', 67, '2020-02-02 20:00:10')
insert into state_stream2(id, location, value, timestamp) values ('dev8', 'ca', 67, '2020-02-02 20:00:10') ('dev3', 'ca', 33, '2020-02-02 20:00:12')

tests.name: recover_hopping_window_aggr_with_delay_interval
tests.description: recover hopping window aggregation with delay interval from a state checkpoint

statements.query: create stream state_stream2 (id string, location string, value float, timestamp datetime64(3) default now64(3))

subscribe to select emit_version(), id, count(*), window_start, window_end from hop(state_stream2, timestamp, interval 3 second, interval 5 second) group by id, window_start, window_end emit stream after watermark and delay interval 2 second settings checkpoint_interval=1
insert into state_stream2(id, location, value, timestamp) values ('dev2', 'ca', 54, '2020-02-02 20:00:03')

tests.name: multiple_times_recover_hopping_window_aggr_with_delay_interval
tests.description: multiple times recover hopping window aggregation with delay interval from a state checkpoint

statements.query: create stream state_stream2 (id string, location string, value float, timestamp datetime64(3) default now64(3))

subscribe to select emit_version(), id, count(*), window_start, window_end from hop(state_stream2, timestamp, interval 3 second, interval 5 second) group by id, window_start, window_end emit stream after watermark and delay interval 2 second settings checkpoint_interval=1
insert into state_stream2(id, location, value, timestamp) values ('dev2', 'ca', 54, '2020-02-02 20:00:03')
insert into state_stream2(id, location, value, timestamp) values ('dev1', 'ca', 55, '2020-02-02 20:00:08') ('dev2', 'ca', 67, '2020-02-02 20:00:04')
insert into state_stream2(id, location, value, timestamp) values ('dev1', 'ca', 55, '2020-02-02 20:00:06') ('dev2', 'ca', 67, '2020-02-02 20:00:11')

tests.name: recover_session_window_aggr
tests.description: recover session window aggregation from a state checkpoint

statements.query: create stream state_stream2 (id string, location string, value float, timestamp datetime64(3) default now64(3))
subscribe to select id, max(value), window_start, window_end from session(state_stream2, timestamp, 2s) group by id, window_start, window_end settings checkpoint_interval=1
insert into state_stream2(id, location, value, timestamp) values ('dev2', 'ca', 66, '2020-02-02 20:00:03')
insert into state_stream2(id, location, value, timestamp) values ('dev3', 'ca', 58.3, '2020-02-02 20:00:05')

tests.name: multiple_times_recover_session_window_aggr
tests.description: multiple times recover session window aggregation from a state checkpoint

statements.query: create stream state_stream2 (id string, location string, value float, timestamp datetime64(3) default now64(3))
subscribe to select id, max(value), window_start, window_end from session(state_stream2, timestamp, 2s) group by id, window_start, window_end settings checkpoint_interval=1
insert into state_stream2(id, location, value, timestamp) values ('dev1', 'ca', 57.3, '2020-02-02 20:00:00')
insert into state_stream2(id, location, value, timestamp) values ('dev2', 'ca', 58.3, '2020-02-02 20:00:00')
insert into state_stream2(id, location, value, timestamp) values ('dev1', 'ca', 60, '2020-02-02 20:00:01')
insert into state_stream2(id, location, value, timestamp) values ('dev2', 'ca', 66, '2020-02-02 20:00:03')
insert into state_stream2(id, location, value, timestamp) values ('dev3', 'ca', 58.3, '2020-02-02 20:00:5')
insert into state_stream2(id, location, value, timestamp) values ('dev4', 'ca', 58.3, '2020-02-02 20:00:16')
